content:
Hi All,
when I am creating the Implementation Guide then I am getting some problem like that:Exception in thread"main" java.lang.error. I am also sending the screenshot for the clear understanding .
if anybody knows about that then ping me.
Thanks
issue.png
you must use the correct case for files throughout the implementation guide - the IG publisher requires you to do so, even though windows or OSX doesn't

you must use the correct case for files throughout the implementation guide - the IG publisher requires you to do so, even though windows or OSX doesn't

I used the files in a correct way only. I will send you those files ig.json
ig.xml
structuredefinition-vms-medicationstatement.xml
Is the "id" of your implementation guide "ig"? Because if not, ig.xml is the wrong filename...

Is the "id" of your implementation guide "ig"? Because if not, ig.xml is the wrong filename...

But in my case id of my Implementation guide is "ig" only as described in files.Then at that case what am I supposed to do.

@Michel Rutten
when I am creating the Implementation guide then I am getting the Exception like that:Exception in thread"main" java.lang.error. I am also sending the screenshot for the clear understanding .
I am not getting when generating the output why it's showing the error like that definitions.html page is generated more than once
issue.png
Hi @abhishek gupta, I'm afraid you'd have to ask @Grahame Grieve. I'm not an expert in using the IG build tool.

@Grahame Grieve
when I am creating the Implementation guide then I am getting the Exception like that:Exception in thread"main" java.lang.error. I am also sending the screenshot for the clear understanding .
I am not getting when generating the output why it's showing the error like that definitions.html page is generated more than once.
issue.png
I will send you files also
ig.json
ig.xml
structuredefinition-vms-medicationstatement.xml
Can you zip up your full IG source folder?
you are defining it twice. in ig.xml or ig.json. if using the spreadsheets or bundle for example you don't list it separately.
show your ig.json and and ig.xml files
you can inspect myIG Sampler to see how these files should look. ( not as fancy as Lloyds :-()
He did include the ig.json and ig.xml. No duplicates that I can see. So my theory is that there are multiple source files in the source folder with the same id
soooo remove half your source files and try again. ( binary search for the offending files)
Arbitrarily picking half will likely mean missing needed files which will trigger a different error. Posting the zip here will let us properly diagnose.
